title:
Three-dimensional exponential mixing and ideal kinematic dynamo with
  randomized ABC flows
authors: Michele Coti Zelati and V\'ictor Navarro-Fern\'andez
abstract:
In this work we consider the Lagrangian properties of a random version of the
Arnold-Beltrami-Childress (ABC) in a three-dimensional periodic box. We prove
that the associated flow map possesses a positive top Lyapunov exponent and its
associated one-point, two-point and projective Markov chains are geometrically
ergodic. For a passive scalar, it follows that such a velocity is a space-time
smooth exponentially mixing field, uniformly in the diffusivity coefficient.
For a passive vector, it provides an example of a universal ideal (i.e.
non-diffusive) kinematic dynamo.
